intro: Trigonochilum miradorense, commonly known as the Mirador orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring three sepals and three petals arranged in a symmetrical pattern. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its flowers are often small and delicate, with a distinctive coloration that ranges from white to pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Trigonochilum miradorense is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in preserving its ecological niche.
